fields.description:
Hi there,

I'm trying to add a hook to one of my repositories in order to be notified when new tags are added. I use this to keep track of the latest version by storing the tag in a database on our web portal.

However there is no tag information in these hooks, any chance they could be added at some point?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Include tag information in POST hooks

fields.description: 500 error issued after logged in.

I know this is one of those intermittent issues that engineers just hate, but the subject says it.

We have a team set up on BitBucket, all contributing to a repo that has a post-commit hook that sends an email diff. The email address for the email diffs is a group alias that our team has used for years. So it's always emailing the same address.

Sometimes the emails come through, and sometimes they don't. It doesn't seem to be associated with any particular user.
fields.summary: Email Diff Hook doesn't always send emails (chokes on large pushes?) (BB-10287)

fields.description: User do not need to see whole edit history of the issue every time he opens it. By default show only 'tab' with comments.
fields.summary: Separate comments and edits into different tabs in the issue view (BB-10257)
Support inline anchor links in Markdown (BB-10269)

fields.description:
Milestones have always displayed fine for me. A few days, they started getting cut off. This stinks because there's so much free space on screen that can be used. I also do not used Votes as this is an internal project and don't understand why it's displaying and taking up so much room.

See attached:\\
http://www.screencast-o-matic.com/screenshots/u/V65s/1394682134201-15484.png
fields.summary: Milestone column in the issues list is too narrow (BB-10268)

fields.description:
Hi, i'm using the report viewer and i'm trying to deploy the spudsoft xls emitter.\\
I copy the jar and the jar of the dependencies to WEB-INF\lib.

When i try to use the emitter i have the following error in the birt log:\\
org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: EmitterID uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.xlsemitter for render option is invalid.

Any idea?

Thanks
fields.summary: Install XLS Emitter

fields.description: Some of our project team are not technical background.  I don't want them to access repository, but just for issue tracker only.  So that they can report bugs or features through bitbucket.  Also, I don't want my project's issues been public.  Are you plan to implement this kind of Access management option in addition to Admin, Read, Write.  For example, "Issues Only".
fields.summary: Feature Request for issue tracker only permission

fields.description:
With the new team accounts how can I obtain an academic plan ?

Some time ago you had to associate an email address with all accounts,  team account as individual ones, and this email address was used to obtain an academic plan or not.

With the new Team system they have only a 5 users free plan.and aren't anymore associated with an an email address or a bitbucket account...
fields.summary: How can I obtain an academic license for a Team account

fields.description: In one of my repositories download size displayed as 308 MB though actual size of the zip is about 30 kB
fields.summary: Wrong download size in overview page

fields.description:
When creating a branch using the Branch button. Bitbucket will create a branch with an empty commit with a commit message of the form "Created new branch $(BranchName)". This causes two issues. It is incompatible with the new JIRA 6.2 increased git integration, and causes problems with rebasing

In JIRA 6.2 issues will now sure the number of commits against each issue. When using Bitbucket's branch functionality, the empty branch commit is counted as a commit by JIRA. Therefore, it appears that there was code committed against an issue, when actually only a branch was created.

When rebasing the branch, the rebase will fail unless the branch commit is marked as skip.

This branch functionality is different than the git command line tool and the normal way of doing git branching. It would be great if this were optional functionality that could be turned off.
fields.summary: Creating Branch Adds Empty Commit

fields.description:
I am trying to integrate bitbucket with our private CI system (buildbot), and bitbucket doesn't seem to run the hook (or it crashes somehow)

the POST url is something along the lines of\\
{{http://user:password@buildbot.domain.com/change_hook/bitbucket}}

another instance where I don't use authentication works fine, so I guess it doesn't like the {{user:password}} part?
fields.summary: POST hook doesn't seem to work if the url contains auth data
CONTACT DETAILS
Contacts Seite 3
Report Date --> Fund Information
Header & Logo (PDF)
Header Logo (Preview & PDF)

fields.description:
For example, if I try to search issues containing "тест" (in Russian)

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?q=%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82

I get normal search results. But when I try to sort them by status after that, I get broken URL (no & symbol between search text and 'sort' param name):

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?q=%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82sort=-status

Screenshot attached.

Tested in Firefox 27.0.1
fields.summary: Broken issues sort URL when trying to sort search results with cyrillic letters in search query. (BB-10266)

fields.description: When you select https, and then click Clone in SourceTree it will open SourceTree using the ssh url anyway.
fields.summary: Clone in SourceTree always chooses SSH URL

fields.description: It would be pretty nice if by default you could see the issues that are either open or on hold. When you put an issue on hold it's really almost like it disappears  unless you go under view all. It's really easy to forget an issue that you put on hold if you can't see the issue after you put it on hold. I really don't want to scroll through or have to dig to find those tickets. If that made sense. Also if we could bulk edit issues that would be pretty cool to.
fields.summary: Feature Request - don't "hide" on-hold issues (BB-10231)

It's a great product, that i love and jira is not my prefered tool for kanban with bitbucket.

fields.description:
I receive a lot of notifications. And when someone sends me a message, in order to reply I have to go back several pages (in inbox) and find the particular notification.

I would appreciate a lot if there's in email a direct link included, or if direct messages have special category to quickly navigate in them.

I'd like to be able, when navigate in the source code in Bitbucket, in a folder, to see the history of this folder. I mean all commits that impacts files in this folder (and children).

Currently, this is possible only for a file, as I know.

fields.description:
Without the ability to very quickly and easily put an image in a wiki, this effort will produce very sub-standard wiki pages.

For it's own good, and the good of every user, image uploads need to become extremely easy to do... two clicks, and done.

Positioning and sizing (with thumbnail support) are desperately needed.

You know, kind of how images are supported right here in issues!!!
fields.summary: Vast improvements in image uploading

fields.description: When referencing commits in the issue tracker, if that commit starts with a number the issue tracker will link you to the issue of that number and not the commit. (i.e. BCLOUD-7b5eac7 will link to issue 7 instead of linking to the commit 7b5eac7)

If the repository is private, it would be good to prevent this.
fields.summary: Publish html documents in a Wiki repo

fields.description:
When I add a user Alias because it's not recognized by default:

Guillaume Demers <IP-0A70D9BD\gdemers>

When I click Add the Alias is added as:

Guillaume Demers <IP-0A70D9BD/gdemers>

Notice the backslash changed to a forward-slash, therefore the user is never recognized.

This is a real problem if we want to switch form TFS to your system.
fields.summary: Adding user aliases rewrites slashes (BB-10230)

fields.description: The "Edit" button positioning gets distorted if the hook url is too long.

fields.description: I love Bitbucket and I use it for almost all of my new coding projects.  When building my resume, it would be great if I could point recruiters to my Bitbucket profile so they can see some of the work I've done.  However, since most of my projects are not open source, I need to keep the repos on the "private" setting, which means that only a handful of my 20+ repos show up on my public profile page.  A feature where you can choose to make the name and description of a repo public, but not the actual source code, would be appreciated.  An extra bonus would be throwing in stats about the repo, like languages used, lines of code, frequency of commits, and so on.
fields.summary: Making repository description and stats public, but not the actual code (BB-10227)

fields.description:
I would find it convenient if the list of SSH keys in account management displayed the respective fingerprints as well. (the output of {{ssh-keygen -l -f keyfile}})

When trying to match which of my many private keys were paired with the public portions in BitBucket, I had to look at the actual content of the public key in BitBucket's interface and compare the lengthy strings or compute the fingerprints myself.

The process would have been a lot simpler if the interface displayed the fingerprints.
fields.summary: Display SSH Key Fingerprint in key listing UI (BB-10208)

fields.description:
Found by accident, when using Wikimedia's GeoHack tool.

A "normal" URL (doesn't contain colon):

{{http://toolserver.org/~geohack/geohack.php?project=osm&params=50_15_N_19_00_E}}

renders correctly -- [example|http://toolserver.org/~geohack/geohack.php%3Fproject%3Dosm%26params%3D50_15_N_19_00_E].

When URL contains colon ({{:}}):

{{http://toolserver.org/~geohack/geohack.php?project=osm&params=50_15_N_19_00_E_type:city}}

It renders a link to current page -- [example|http://toolserver.org/~geohack/geohack.php%3Fproject%3Dosm%26params%3D50_15_N_19_00_E_type:city]

(edit source of this issue, to see, that the same URL as above is given in this link).
fields.summary: Markdown renders incorrect link, when URL contains colon (BB-10228)

however that command gives me the following error :

_remote: permission denied to delete branch (branch_name)\\
To https://(my_account)@bitbucket.org/specialsource-ondemand/(repo).git\\
! [remote rejected] (branch_name) (pre-receive hook declined)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://(my_account)@bitbucket.org/specialsource-ondemand/(repo).git'_

----
Why am I unable to delete the branch at origin?\\
Am I doing something wrong?
fields.summary: Cannot delete remote branch; "remote: permission denied to delete branch (name)"

fields.description:
I tried to import some of my GitHub repos to Bitbucket but I ended up at an endless spinning circle... When I tried to disconnect my GitHub account, I got an error saying that I have to set a password fist. I do have a password set and even changing it didn't work.

I then revoked access to Bitbucket in my GitHub account and got the error "We're having trouble connecting to Github :(" at the 'Connected Accounts' section. When I press the 'Reconnect' button, I can authorize Bitbucket as an Application at GitHub but when I press 'Authorize application' I get redirected to a 505 Bitbucket page.

Could it be because I changed my account name on GitHub recently?

Thanks in advance!

Adding user to private repo results in uncaught exception. ugly error! (BB-10202)

fields.description:
Our company has a team on BitBucket. We've added an email diff hook to our main repository. I've noticed that for most team members the commit email subject always uses the full name (i.e. "commit/java: Joe Smith") but for other users the commit email subject always uses the username (i.e. "commit/java: djones").

It's not a big deal, but the inconsistency is puzzling.

I'm one of the latter users (always the username). My first name and last name are set on the account. I've tried fiddling with everything I could think of (SSH keys, etc.) to no effect.

The only thing that might matter is that I and the two other users who are username-only in the emails had at some point changed the username on our account. I'm wondering if that permanently disconnected some user information on the backend somehow.
fields.summary: Inconsistent usage of username/full-name in commit emails (BB-10196)

fields.description: In any repository when you click on the commits tab, there is no longer the nice graph on the left side. I believe this is a bug.
fields.summary: What happened to the nice graph ?

fields.description:
I'm new here and i've used git before but still pretty clueless. I just went to set up a new repository and followed the steps. When I got to

fields.description:
I have a need for [markup for both subscripts and tables|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3538/allow-safe-html-tags-to-be-rendered-in] in both {{README}}s and wikis. I thought BB-reST might satisfy this requirement, since reST supports both and BB supports reST for both {{README}}s and wikis.

I run debian with pandoc=1.9.4.2 installed, so I downloaded one of my {{README.md}}s, converted it to reST, and edited the output, eventually producing https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/raw/dc5d1087f0741786b300d2676b2a500c72dcbf92/README.rst

When I convert that to PDF with

{code}
pandoc -r rst ./README.rst -o ./README.pdf
{code}

the [output PDF|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/downloads/README.pdf] renders appropriately. Thus I claim my {{README.rst}} is "pandoc-correct" ... unless pandoc's LaTeX renderer is correcting output from its reST renderer, which seems unlikely.

But the BB-reST renderer @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox (or @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/src/dc5d1087f0741786b300d2676b2a500c72dcbf92/README.rst?at=master ) fails to render 1 of the many simple links in that README.rst: the second link in the first sentence of paragraph=summary (near top of page). Again, this link, as well as all the others, was [rendered correctly by pandoc|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/downloads/README.pdf] (see top of PDF p1/5) from the same source {{README.rst}}.

Note that [BB-reST also fails to render subscripts correctly|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9077/bb-restructuredtext-does-not-support], which also may be causing its failure to render another, subscript-containing link in TODO 4/9 (near bottom of page). However

* again, [pandoc renders the subscript-containing link correctly|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/downloads/README.pdf]--see top of PDF p5/5.
* the BB-reST subscript-rendering issue should have no direct impact on _this_ link-rendering issue.
fields.summary: README.rst fails to render 1 {simple, pandoc-renderable} link

fields.description:
I have a need for [markup for both subscripts and tables|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3538/allow-safe-html-tags-to-be-rendered-in] in both {{README}}s and wikis. I thought BB-reST might satisfy this requirement, since reST supports both and BB supports reST for both {{README}}s and wikis.

I run debian with pandoc=1.9.4.2 installed, so I downloaded one of my {{README.md}}s, converted it to reST, and edited the output, eventually producing https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/raw/dc5d1087f0741786b300d2676b2a500c72dcbf92/README.rst

When I convert that to PDF with

{code}
pandoc -r rst ./README.rst -o ./README.pdf
{code}

the output ( https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/downloads/README.pdf ) renders subscripts appropriately, so my syntax is pandoc-correct. (Unless pandoc's LaTeX renderer is correcting output from its reST renderer, which seems unlikely.) But the BB-reST renderer @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox (or @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/lightningnox/src/dc5d1087f0741786b300d2676b2a500c72dcbf92/README.rst?at=master ) does not render the subscripts correctly. (BB-reST also has a problem rendering some links, for which I made a [separate issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9078/readmerst-fails-to-render-1-simple-pandoc].)
fields.summary: BB-reStructuredText does not support subscripts? (BB-10188)

fields.description:
The "Find Repositories" search/filter function is case sensitive and does a "starts with" search on repo name.  It should be case insensitive, and do an "in" search on repo name.

In the case where there are a lot of repositories that start with the same string (eg. we name our repositories with the client or overarching product name as the first part - this means a lot start with the same string), this would make it much easier to find the repository being looked for.
fields.summary: Repository filter should be case insensitive and perform "in" search on repo name. (BB-10189)

fields.description:
I have the following string in my README.md file: 
1.  Download Composer:
```sh
curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php -d detect_unicode=Off -d phar.readonly=Off -d phar.require_hash=Off
```
2.  Install components using Composer
```sh
php -d detect_unicode=Off -d phar.readonly=Off -d phar.require_hash=Off composer.phar install
```
Bitbucket parses lists totally wrong. Example repo: https://bitbucket.org/p0rsche/klarna_reports/overview
fields.summary: Wrong parsing of ordered lists in markdown

fields.description:
The # and ! characters in creole links became urlencoded after last updates (I've noticed this change today, and it worked a few days ago).

Was:\\
{{[[ArticleName#!anchor]] == /.../wiki/ArticleName#!anchor}}

Now:\\
{{[[ArticleName#!anchor]] == /.../wiki/ArticleName%23%21anchor}}

So it is now impossible to put the same link as {{<<toc>>}} generates manually.

I have used this feature in my docs builder, and it is completely broken now.
fields.summary: #! characters in creole wiki links became urlencoded (BB-10187)

fields.description:
We would like to introduce Megam (www.gomegam.com) - a PaaS for deploying applications to Any cloud. Using this platform you will be able to deploy applications developed in Bitbucket, CloudForge, scm-manager.org, Github,[any git] to any cloud like HP , AWS, Profitbricks.com, podnix.cometc as well as private clouds and also monitor them. So the missing part of testing in cloud can also be added. We would like to partner with you and offer these features. We have done similar work for open source scm-manager.org. We developed the plug-ins for scm-manager.com. The applications are completely integrated and they sync with the development cycle continuously We would love to demonstrate Megam to you. Let us know if there is a interest in Bitbucket on this feature.

Our developed code is available in here : https://github.com/indykish
fields.summary: Continuous integration of code to any cloud.
Markdown renderer fails to handle certain links (BB-10248)

fields.summary: Reset password

fields.description:
After searching, I know this has been discussed multiple times, for example here: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5179/add-a-status-of-closed-to-issues

Each time the decision is something like "We have decided to keep the issue tracker as simple as possible", without any reasonable explanation.

*HOW COME ADDING ONE MORE "CLOSED" STATE WOULD MAKE THE ISSUE TRACKER NOT SIMPLE ANYMORE?* It is so simple to implement this new feature (just add one more statue, you don't even need to change your issue system's source code), it is also simple for end user to use it, and it is even as simple as right now if an end user decide to not use it. So what is the logic behind the "keep it simple" answer?

My guess is that the issue tracker was originally designed for (and perhaps by?) solo developer, who takes full authority to say whether a bug is done; when he said it is "resolved", he means "closed". This assumption is fundamentally wrong when a project becomes serious and involves QA team and management team.

Please, bitbucket team, wake up.
fields.summary: Add a status "closed" to issues

fields.description:
Hi. When I try to add another ssh key to my account, I get an error

{code}
Someone has already registered this as a deploy key.
{code}

I checked all my repositories and there are no deployment keys in any of them. I can only assume that this is the same problem as mentioned in Issue BCLOUD-8568: I might have used the key in the now-deleted repository "dotfiles".

I tried using the REST API to delete the key manually but that just gives me a 404.

Could you please check if the there's a deployment key associated with my account and delete it? I can supply the pub key via PM if necessary.

Thanks a lot.
fields.summary: Can't add ssh key (exists as deployment key, possibly in deleted repo)

I can't say I know why this happens, but I figured I should file it as a bug, since it's clearly kinda strange. :)

I don't know if it may be related to the fact that, when I visit the "Plans and billing" part of my account setting, the "Change plan" button is disabled with a spinner image spinning forever to its left.
fields.summary: ５ user plan does not leave room for 1 user

fields.description:
We have a team with 8 users. All have admin access.\\
We have a number of private repositories. Some where created as user-repos and afterwards transfered to the team.

When a user who has not created the repo and only has access to the repo due to the team membership is trying to access the repo page, he will be redirected to the admin-page.\\
The workaround is to add the user explicitly (he can do this himself) as an admin on the repo.
